Key Match Events: Quentin Grimes scored 23 points and grabbed 9 rebounds for the Mavericks
Dallas out-rebounded the Lakers 44-33 and had 11 offensive rebounds for 15 second-chance points
Post-Match Reflections: Quentin Grimes told broadcaster TNT, 'We knew we had to get back on track. Came out with the right mindset after dropping five in a row, so good to get back on track.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dallas, last season's Western Conference champions, had gone 1-5 since losing Luka Doncic to a calf strain on Christmas Day. Still without the Slovenian star, they announced on Monday that Kyrie Irving would be sidelined for some time with a lower back sprain.
Others: Anthony Davis scored 21 points and pulled down 12 rebounds for the Lakers and LeBron James added 18 points, 10 boards and 8 assists.
